comment: The class work it self is tolerable.12 quizzes,Two projects,Midterm,and final. The midterm and final are lockdown and webcam. There are also worded weird, I did good on quizzes but fail both test due to that reason. Grades do come in late and there's barely communication between the class and her. It's almost radio silent majority of the semester.

No matter what professor you take for this course it has the same amount of work which is A LOT. Dr. C was amazing, only 2 exams no proctor but a lot of assignments, quizzes and readings. She was easy to reach and I would love to take her again. Not sure why she has bad reviews, she is amazing!
Its December and an assignment that was due in October is still not graded. Extreme uncertainty and technical issues for the last assignment in the class. Avoid this professor if you can.

Awful at communication, and never puts grades in on time. It's November and I don't even know what my grade in the class is. She doesn't even teach anything and at this point Mcgraw is the teacher. Also, we have random assignments on D2L and group projects when none of us has met before. So many people dropped. Don't waste your time.

attendance is mandatory with a "word of the day" given at the end of class that you enter into a submission box. you can get these from a friend, but they're only open until 15 minutes after class ends. doesn't tell you when assignments arent required, but unlike other profs, she walks you through some classwork and the excel project. no rubrics.

If you do your work-no complaints. She loves to talk, she is opinionated and interesting to listen to. NOT a quick grader. If you go to class every day she notices. She is lenient with certain things and keeps pushing back due dates. No idea what my grade in the class was until posted bc there were NO grades in the book. She is very nice though

Dr. C is super nice, she's a fun professor and grants extensions, while she can be difficult to reach outside of class, the course is not hard, and you will find her directions to be very clear. I've taken her both for IS 2200, and 3100. Choose good partners for the group project, it is a huge part of your grade.

Class consisted of midterm and final, 12 quizzes one for each chapter and two projects.  The professor did not submit grades in a timely manner. She waits until a day before the final to input grades and feedback.  Very difficult or impossible to contact her.  Sent emails and never got a response. Would avoid this teacher next time.

Dr. Hollingsworth is an outstanding professor who goes above and beyond for her students. She's incredibly kind and dedicated, making every lesson engaging and understandable. Her genuine care for students' success is evident, creating a supportive and positive learning environment. I would happily take her class again. 10 stars!

Prof is incredibly unorganized and does not give clear instructions for some of the assignments. She will NOT respond to your emails. It is 5/8 and she is just now making every single grade available to us. We still do not know our big project grade. And she sucks at sticking to the syllabus or making a clear one. Content is fine, lot of busy work.

Super nice lady, super ADHD. Majority of the lecture was covering everything in the world other than IS. We rarely went over anything of actual importance. The course was online heavy, and she is completely disorganized. Grading rarely happens. Communication is nonexistent. D2L was a mess. Sweet lady, not a great teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Honestly, the class is easy, and I got A's on everything except the midterm and final which are poorly worded. I waited almost 2 months for a big project grade. I'll be surprised if the 2nd project grade comes in before grades are due. You will never know where you stand in the class. You won't be able to ask her questions. She is inaccessible.

Avoid this professor if you can. She is not clear about instructions for assignments, and she is not organized at all about assignment due dates. On top of that, multiple students in my class had a really hard time getting in touch with her. She also does not put in grades in a timely manner.

Taken during my first semester at college in Fall 2022. Easily my favorite professor at KSU thus far. Taught the material well, had open-book exams & quizzes, adjusted due dates as needed, easy to get ahold of in and outside of class, and really made an effort to care about her students as well as the in-class lectures. If you can, take Dr. C!

not easy to get ahold of, which is difficult due to it being a fully online class. Has like 8-10 quizzes over chapters but does this twice. and 5 assignments which you can only access when it opens, midterm and final. and group project. but there's almost no information about it so it's been difficult.

Do not take this professor at all for online class! She did not put in grades throughout the semester, she waited until two days before the semester was over. A bunch of quizzes for the class on connect. This class was a busy class and there is a group project/excel project. No tests besides the midterm and final.

Professor H is a very nice and caring person. Her lectures can be interesting, but they're not particularly helpful for the course. She does a pretty good job guiding you through the Excel project, but her directions for the other projects are vague. You should be able to get at least a B in her course, but you won't get that much out of it.

I took this professor Spring 23' and she was amazing!  I'm not sure why she has a low rating, but definitely take her for information systems!! Now I will say, she does not teach, and tends to ramble about random stuff, but the assignments are online & VERY easy. The nicest prof that I've met here. She is caring and will grant extensions!!

While the professor is nice, she would just ramble during most of the class time. She would barely show us how to use excel and expected us to know what to do. She takes her time grading assignments and is slow at responding emails. While it is an "easy" class, don't expect to learn real information about Information systems.

Lectures were useless to go to. Assignments had little instruction and what was there was not clear. Did not respond to emails. She's a nice person, but her class was so frustrating. Group project at the end worth like 20% of your grade that she tells you almost nothing about.

Course work is easy enough, 2 exams totaling 40% are webcam lockdown browser, and half of the course work is due by midterms and the other half is due by finals, so you really have to pace yourself. She is hard to get in contact with, never set up the teams channel as stated in our syllabus and takes over a week to reply to emails/d2l. Overall okay

This professor does not teach the class. She puts instructions in the syllabus and then expects you to know what to do. The tests did not go over what her "interactive" book goes over when studying. Doesn't have any lectures or study guides. I've taken many online courses and they have been more interactive with their students than this professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Test heavy

comment: My favorite professor EVER at KSU. She is always willing to help so you can get the best grades possible. She basically did the entire excel project for us. Attendance isnt required and tests and quizzes are open note. Midterm and final didnt count much towards the final grade. Very project heavy which made it easy in my opinion. Take her!!!!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Do not take this class with this professor.

Going to lectures is useless, and never stayed on topic. 20 quizzes are due in total, on top of two extra assignments due with each quiz. That does not include, the projects and extra assignments. Directions were never clear and she responded slowly. I would not recommend her to anyone.

Shes not a terrible teacher but shes also not a good one. Theres no point to attend lectures until she goes over the excel project. There are about 20 quizzes in total with 10 due before the midterm and 10 due before the final. The quiz questions are pretty random. Her directions on the projects dont always make sense so reach out to her.

Professor Hollingsworths ratings on here dont make sense to me. She deserves higher. There are three projects, quizzes, a midterm, and a final. The class isnt structured to turn things in weekly, you turn them in when you want to. Shes a GREAT grader. The projects all come with detailed walk-throughs. Its an EASY A if YOU PUT IN the effort.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Literally take her! Thank me later! Im not sure why everyone is bashing her. She will literally meet with you outside of the class if something is confusing you. She is great to talk to about anything. Yes going to her classes are pretty much pointless but she does still teach just gets off on tangents a lot! She is by far one of my all time favs!

She is NOT a teacher. Lectures are worthless. Class was 100% self taught. Takes up all your time. Insane volume of reading, 2-3 chapters/week covering unrelated topics that have nothing to do with the weekly projects. Tests/quizzes full of broken questions, only cover least relevant info. Lost access to 3rd book days before final. total nightmare.
rating_tags: Group projects--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Does not reply to emails. Does not teach what she assigns. Does not enter the grades on time.

Beware if you care about your grades. She will sneak in misleading workarounds in projects to find any small way to bring your grade down. And the exams are full of questions with multiple correct answers so you're left guessing. She has always responded decently quickly to emails.

Online only student. Worse experience yet. I received a B which was probably fair. All material except 3 projects are thru Pearson online. Unresponsive to emails, no lectures for online learners. Due dates weren't given or changed at will. Test not related to text read for assigned chapters. Self taught entire class. Pointless!

As long as you are decent with pacing yourself to turn in assignments you will be fine. Dr. C's class is set up with multiple assignments due on one date. She gives your opportunity(weeks) to complete the assignments at your own pace. I think thats what most of the complaining is about. Midterm & final you can still pass class without acing them.

Awful at communication. Unclear grading requirements. Class is not worth going to, because she goes off on a million tangents. I taught myself all the material. Midterm was very hard despite studying and 3/4 of the class failed. Most assignments wont be graded until last week of school.

Okay, so this professor just rants and rants so there isn't a point in attending lectures. The tests are very opinionated questions, good luck on those. The amount of work there is for an intro class is insane, and don't even try to guess your grade before the class is finished because I am still waiting on grades from September 24th and its Nov.

1. Doesn't respond to emails 2. Isn't clear about instructions and if you ask will act rude 3. Tons of group assignments 4. Doesn't grade anything until the last week of school 5. Requires a lot of work outside of class 6. Hardly reviews what appears on the midterm, final, and quizzes Beware!
she doesnt respond to emails, she doesnt give enough information to complete assignments properly, and she packs on a ton of assignments. id try someone else

Worst professor ever. Never grades on time. Directions and instructions are very unclear, noncommunicative and the course is intensive. Your will work for every grade, but you won't know grades for weeks on end. She adds a lot of assignments as she goes along, the schedule is never corect and due dates change all the time.

Ms. Hollingsworth is a very slow grader and poor at communication. She only posted a few announcements/updates throughout the semester. Also, she failed to assign us topics for our research/peer-review assignment and failed to provide the reading material for our labs which was promised in the syllabus. You'll survive but I'd go with someone else.

This professor is a very nice lady. But she isn't a teacher. More of just a person who talks about their experience in the industry and how it could apply to what she's supposed to be teaching. Lots of projects, She kinda walks you through them, but not in detail. She curves the tests. Good lucking finding what your grade is during the semester.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Online class. Expected students to form their own groups for group project? A LOT of projects, some harder than necessary/involved more knowledge than class taught. Ex: Excel Project was a full Business Plan which needed Accounting skills. Grades slow. Little feedback. I got an A, but have no idea what I did right or wrong on projects.

Dr. H is a really nice lady. I'm sure she is great outside of school, but she has no place in the classroom. I've taken her 3 times now (IS 2200, 2 ISA courses). My biggest issue: It takes months for her to grade assignments. Most assignments, even those that we did at the beginning of the semester, were graded in the last week of the school year.

Professor Hollingsworth had terrible communication skills throughout the semester. She rarely responded to e-mails and still has not graded 1/10th of the material that has been completed even as this semester closes. Her course outlines are vague, incomplete, and written by a different instructor. Professor Hollingsworth did not teach this class.

Dr. Hollingsworth legitimately cares about her students. Her assignments and exams are the appropriate level of difficulty and she does a fine job of giving feedback on what you could do better. I have taken her a few times and have never made less than an A. Take the time to develop a good rapport and you'll be fine.

Took her for a Maymester online. Assigned discussion postings and quizzes for each chapter, virtualized labs, multiple essays, a research paper, and 2 exams. Offers extra credit. Late assignments not accepted. You'll do fine if you really put in the work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Horrible. She's unprepared, makes errors in her videos and homework assignments, has VERY unclear project rules, does not provide students with the necessary tools to be successful (i.e. instructions on how to complete projects) AND she expects you to have a mastery of TI-84 calculator for an INTRODUCTORY course AVOID. AVOID. AVOID.

Dr. Hollingsworth is the laziest teacher I've ever had. She "taught" this online class, but what that really means is that she signed up to teach it, took parts of courses from other teachers and pieced them all together, and sat back for the rest of the year and collected the check. Don't take her.

If you submit a written assignment, be prepared to receive no actual feedback. Professor is picky about formatting of pages but has many poorly formatted pages across the entirety of the course content. The worst online class I've taken. Many of the video lecture files are plagued with double audio recording, making them completely unusable.

I like her as a person, but as a teacher umm no. I am a little bit of a nerd and I expected to learn something, she does not teach, does not respond to emails, does not grade on time. She babbles about how hard her life is like we are not living lol. I would not recommend taking her, but I think she is the only option at Kennasaw, unfortunately.

Not an intro course but is a basic course. Course is not easy because of the content and amount of work but if you put in the effort an A is doable. Dr H is a good professor and responded quickly to my questions. There were weekly modules and quizzes, a few discussion posts, projects/mini projects, and 2 tests. Don't procrastinate.
She gives you more chances than anyone deserves to make an A. Take her when possible.

Awful teacher who makes this class way harder than it should be. The test are over useless material on lockdown browser. Was my first C in college. Just a bunch of busy work assigned but not given back in a timely manner. Would have probably got an A if I brought her chickfila

She was okay overall; not very clear with instructions and she didn't grade things in a timely manner. I think the layout of the course was the biggest issue. Many of the projects assumed proficiency in areas that I don't think many people have (i.e Excel, HTML). Some of the material was difficult to follow. Didn't feel like an intro class.

if youre taking IS 2200 and couldnt find an easier professor for this subject, take Hollingsworth online. The other reviews make her sound bad but her online version of 2200 is good. Weekly modules with quizzes andoccasional assignments. Easy stuff. 2 tests that arent extremely difficult. Group project in online class is weird but doable.

This is the second class I've taken with Hollingsworth.  The only reason I took it is because I know she likes me and will work with me--which she has.  Overall, not the most effective teacher, but she will help in an instant if you ask.  Pay attention, READ!, and make sure to pace yourself with the workload, and you'll do alright.

Super nice professor!! This was my second time taking her! You only have 6 quizzes, 3 tests, 3 case analyses and 1 group project!! So easy and a completely do-able work load! Would totally take her again!!

This lady comes off as a nice teacher but in actuality she is the devil in disguise. She is never clear on what she wants from you out the project. She assumes everyone already knows this and it is very easy (when it is not)! She likes to talk about how great yet horrible her life is and she loves to make the class feel like a bunch of dumb asses!

As an IS major the class is in my interests, but its a struggle to go to class. When you are in class she teaches about different topics and gets easily distracted. The mini projects are interesting and I actually learned while I did it. The tests are VERY difficult and you have to teach yourself EVERYTHING on them in order to MAYBE pass them.

She is awful, don't take her!!! she makes this class so much harder than it should be. The tests are hard; the test content is nothing like her lectures. This class has only two tests, a midterm and a final, and Its a lot of work.

This is the worst college instructor I've had yet!  Unclear, slow to grade assignments, calendar is useless, unreasonable expectations of students...the list goes on.  I might have had more help from an English teacher.  Knowing what I know now, I'd have preferred to take this course online.

she talks about her personal life everyday and guess what? its stupid and her life is boring. and her quizzes are ridiculous. they seem easy but end up being hard. i would advise just to take it online. its not even worth coming to class.
DO NOT TAKE. Horrible teacher, very unclear with assignments, and how she wants assignments done. Spends majority of class talking about herself. Worst teacher I have had at KSU
